Reviews.Title: Audio could use some work
Reviews.Author: Jenn
Reviews.Content: The picture quality is pretty good but the audio is lacking. The sound is quite tinny and seems to echo if you have to turn the volume up to any point above 1/3 the maximum volume. There is also a several second delay when you turn the unit on before a picture appears. We were never able to find a remote code that works with tivo so we constantly have to have two remotes in hand.Edited to add: The audio is so annoying that we are returning the tv. It's just too difficult to listen to it. I wish I could lower my star rating.

Reviews.Title: Good value, great picture
Reviews.Author: Maggie B
Reviews.Content: I bought this product last week. I wanted a name brand, and this was the best deal. Some sets this size and price don't have HDMI, or have only one input. The picture is fine I don't have a problem with the sound- it's what you expect from small speakers.I got this to replace a small CRT. There are 2 HDMI inputs, plus the 5 wire color-coded input from a cable box, which is what I'm using. Add to that analog PC input, S-video, RCA and audio input from a PC. If you want to use this as a computer monitor, be aware the screen does not tilt.This would be a good TV for a dorm room, which is where it may end up if my daughter gets her hands on it!Update: Just before the return period ended, the set stopped working. Great while it lasted!I was able to get something else a little bigger.

Reviews.Title: Good television for the price
Reviews.Author: TW990
Reviews.Content: I bought this television recently at Sears on sale for 200 dollars. The picture quality is good (not great, but good) and sound quality is okay as well. I understand how some people might be frustrated with the picture and the sound, but a name brand 19 inch 720p HDTV with two HDMI inputs for 200? I was impressed. You shouldn't expect the quality of say a Samsung or Sony for this price, but realistically, like I've said this is an excellent buy for a small room. People expect to much.

Reviews.Title: poor sound quality
Reviews.Author: chris
Reviews.Content: We just bought this tv. after reading the 2 previous reviews that pointed out the poor sound quality.I guess we assumed the reviewers were exaggerating the problem. We own a 13" tv/ vcr that we had been usingand we figured that although the reviews for this tv warned us of  tinny audio issues it couldn't be worse than our 15 year old ,13" tv. we were wrong. It's unbearable! Perhaps it has a lot to do with the size and shape of our room, In any event we now need to invest in 50$-100$ worth of surround sound. or send the tv back.  the picture could be ok, I dont know? I cant endure having the thing on long enough to tell. For the time being im going back to my 13"tv/vcr.

Reviews.Title: Ok
Reviews.Author: Arthu P. Fortunato
Reviews.Content: For Starters I'll say you get what you pay for.  The picture is clear and you can change the color mode. Meaning it has a energy saving  option which is cool.  As with other reviews I must agree that the volume control sucks.  Their times when the volume is at its max to hear the show your watching.  I would say it is better as Monitor for a desktop computer. It went from being our bedroom tv to our current computer monitor.

Reviews.Title: Great picture, really bad audio
Reviews.Author: Randall Ballschmiede
Reviews.Content: The good news.  We bought this TV for our master bedroom and am impressed with the picture for the price.  Now the bad news.  The audio portion takes me back to the days of listenig to an old AM tansister radio!  Even though the bass and treble are adjustable it is terrible but for $200.00 I can't say too much and again the picture is great.

Reviews.Title: OK for what it is . . .
Reviews.Author: P. Ingalls "Amazon regular"
Reviews.Content: We purchased this sylvania based on price to replace an ancient 13" RCA crt tv that had no inputs except a coax f connector and the screw terminals for the rabbit ears - (anyone want an antique?)The sound quality, as noted by others, is quite poor and there's only one watt of audio power per channel.The customer service people are unable (unwilling?) to provide a discreet code for the ir remote - so you're stuck using two remotes if you have TIVO or other components; or a universal learning remote. Seems an archaic and unfriendly stance . . .; if we choose to return this unit on the sound quality, we WON'T be choosing another Sylvania.

Reviews.Title: I have had no issues with this little TV!
Reviews.Author: Earl Schube
Reviews.Content: This little TV is in my bedroom and get's a lot of use and I have had simply no issues with it.  I would buy it again.

Reviews.Title: Perfect little HDTV
Reviews.Author: Robert D. Cleaves
Reviews.Content: I have the larger 32" in in the living room the picture and problem free  last 2 years are what sold me on getting this one for the bedroom. It's clear and crisp, its not that loud but that is what the living room TV is for. I'd recommend this tv to anyone and when the time and money comes I'll get a bigger Sylvania, great quality system.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the Price
Reviews.Author: J. Harston
Reviews.Content: I am really pleased with this TV.  Great product for the price.  We wanted something small to go in our bedroom.  Images are sharp and the sound is good (despite some negative reviews) for a small TV.  Inputs: HDMI, component, composite and others give you connection options and a PC input allows you to use the TV as a computer monitor.It was almost impossible to determine from the manual and Sylvania's on-line resources what HD resolution [720p, etc...] the TV runs at.  For the record, the resolution is widescreen HD resolution of 1440x900 "XVGA" (one step down from 720p).  But if you are shopping for a 19-inch TV screen you probably shouldn't insist on numbers like 720p and 1080p--that becomes more important on larger screen sizes.My only complaint is the model is too new to accept codes from my satellite TV remote.  Using two remotes is a bit of a pain, but I'm hoping they come up with a new code to fix this issue.

Reviews.Title: Audio Really Does suck
Reviews.Author: Velvet23
Reviews.Content: The audio is pretty bad. I had a regular Sylvania before and the audio was not that bad. It must just be this model. Don't buy it. Invest in a better brand or try a different model.

Reviews.Title: terrible audio for this nice tv
Reviews.Author: J. B. "Deez Nuts"
Reviews.Content: "The picture quality is pretty good but the audio is lacking. The sound is quite tinny and seems to echo if you have to turn the volume up to any point above 1/3 the maximum volume. There is also a several second delay when you turn the unit on before a picture appears." My sentiments exactly, Jenn. Great TV, but the audio is poor. Now I gotta figure out if I want to bother returning it or buying external speakers.

Reviews.Title: Sounds like garbage
Reviews.Author: Erin
Reviews.Content: I've had this for less than two years and the sound quality just got awful.  We can't really even use the tv any more.  I don't know how to describe it...it's like we're listening to the tv under water or something.  I can't afford a new TV every two years though! I'm very mad!

Reviews.Title: Sylvania LC195SL9 19-Inch LCD HDTV
Reviews.Author: dfern22
Reviews.Content: Received some time ago and never rated product.So far it is in use in my kitchen and still works fine,no problems and I'm sure it is probably cheaper now.

Reviews.Title: SHORT-Lived
Reviews.Author: Tom S
Reviews.Content: The TV died one week past waranty, back to using my thirty-year-old Sony Trinitron in the meantime.  Will not go back to Sylvania.

Reviews.Title: Outstanding!!!
Reviews.Author: Joseph Smith Jr. "Joe Smith"
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV for my son who is a freshman in college and he absolutely loves it. its a steal at only $200. I recommend this TV to everyone!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Good Picture, Good Price, Decent Audio
Reviews.Author: Mr. C
Reviews.Content: For [...] bucks, (look around and you'll find it for this price), you can't go wrong with this tv.  For the people that do not like the audio, I have a simple solution for you.  Go out and buy $[...] computer speakers.  The TV has an audio input for this.  A cheap way to get more audio power.  The picture and price is what attracted me to this set...if you don't want to spend $[...] and up for a similar sized Samsung (which I think are great TVs) then this is for you.Pros: Picture, price, simple setupCons: Audio could be more powerful, but easily solved with external speakers.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the Value
Reviews.Author: J. Faust
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV to use in my home office and was pleased with the speed in which I received it from Amazon, the ease of set up and its quality for the price range.  I'm using it with a "rabbit ear" antenna and get all of the local digital channels with good reception.  I know some reviewers questioned the sound quality, but for where and how I'm using it, I don't have any issues or concerns.

Reviews.Title: It makes a great computer monitor
Reviews.Author: J. Perkins "Perki"
Reviews.Content: It makes a great computer monitor for gaming, flight simulators, etc. It seems to be faster than the monitor I bought, also the computer speakers make up for the sound issues.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the price!
Reviews.Author: Barbara Baskin
Reviews.Content: I'm happy with my purchase. I'm not crazy about the stand as it wobbles just a bit but I don't have kids or pets that might knock it over. At first, I didn't like the sound quality but soon learned there was nothing wrong with it. It was just different from my old 15-year-old tv.

Reviews.Title: missing base!
Reviews.Author: nk
Reviews.Content: Does anyone know where we can find parts for this tv?  We are missing the piece that the base attaches to.  Any suggestions?

Reviews.Title: UNHAPPY
Reviews.Author: S. Smith "S. SMITH"
Reviews.Content: Please do not purchase. I do not know what the picture quality or sound is like, my TV never worked.  I tried take it to a local service center, to find out they have not done busy with this company in 5 years or more.  I had to send it back to the company, that was in September of 2008 and this is February and I am still trying to find out when I will get my TV or money.  This company has the worse customer service I have ever had to deal with.  The biggest problem is level one - level three can not help you. When you have endured all you can take and ask for a supervisor, their response is I will have have to have administration call you back.  Guest what ....I AM STILL WAITING.

Reviews.Title: I HAD TO SEND IT BACK.
Reviews.Author: PATRICIA C. MCGRADY
Reviews.Content: WHEN I WAS SETTING UP THE TV, I HAD A TERRIBLE TIME CONNECTING THE ANTENNA, AND PUTTING ON THE STAND.  WHEN I FINALLY GOT IT WORKING, THE PICTURE WAS NOT GOOD: TERRIBLE ON SOME CHANNELS, AND BETTER ON OTHERS.  I TRIED EVERYTHING, INCLUDING HAVING MY YOUNG, TECHIE FRIEND COME OVER AND TRY TO GET A GOOD PICTURE TO NO AVAIL.  I SENT IT BACK, AND ASKED FOR A REFUND FROM TIGEREXPRESS.  I WILL NEVER BUY AN ELECTRONIC BY COMPUTER AGAIN!  I ALSO HAD A TERRIBLE TIME GETTING THE STAND BACK OFF SO I COULD PACK IT TO SEND IT BACK.  AND I HAD TO PAY THE SHIPPING MYSELF BECAUSE THE WHOLE PROCESS HAD TAKEN MORE THAN 30 DAYS....  PHOOEY!  PMCG IN ARLINGTON, VIRGINIA

ProductInfo.Features:
1440 x 900 Resolution and 1000:1 Contrast Ratio
HDTV Display with PC input
V Chip with Downloadable Rating
Digital ATSC Tuner
ProductInfo.Name: Sylvania LC195SL9 19-Inch LCD HDTV
